alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 9:24PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN WEST FELICIANA, WEST BATON ROUGE, WEST CENTRAL ST. HELENA, POINTE COUPEE, SOUTHERN EAST FELICIANA, NORTHWESTERN IBERVILLE AND EAST BATON ROUGE PARISHES THROUGH 1015 PM CST... At 924 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near St. Francisville to near Cecilia. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Port Allen, New Roads, St. Francisville, Livonia, Maringouin, Slaughter, Fordoche, Rosedale, Morganza, Merrydale, Erwinville, Pride, Brownfields, Greenwell Spring, Lottie, and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 144 and 158. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana
